context: Tests whether the agent correctly creates AGENTS.md for a simple single-package project following the skill's discovery workflow, structure decision, and anti-pattern avoidance principles.

checklist.name: Discovery performed
checklist.description: Agent ran discovery commands (rg or similar) to understand the repository structure before creating documentation

checklist.name: Technology detection
checklist.description: Agent detected actual technology stack (package manager, testing framework, etc.) from config files rather than assuming

checklist.name: Single file structure
checklist.description: Created single AGENTS.md at root (not unnecessary hierarchical structure for simple project)

checklist.name: Concise content
checklist.description: Content is concise and not encyclopedic (no full framework manuals embedded)

checklist.name: Path-specific commands
checklist.description: Commands include specific paths relevant to this project, not generic placeholders

checklist.name: Verified commands
checklist.description: Commands appear to be valid for the detected project (e.g., correct package manager commands)

checklist.name: No assumptions
checklist.description: Documentation reflects discovered technologies, not assumed ones

checklist.name: Actionable instructions
checklist.description: Instructions are concrete and actionable, not vague

checklist.name: Discovery commands included
checklist.description: Includes useful discovery commands for future agents (e.g., file listing, config detection)

checklist.name: Quality check
checklist.description: Documentation appears validated (no obvious broken links or invalid commands)
